00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlOptionsNode - MRML node for storing browser-specific data.
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // Option nodes allow browser-specific information to be stored in
00017 // a MRML file.  For example, the 3D Slicer uses Option nodes to store
00018 // the user's 3D viewpoint information since there currently is no
00019 // View node in MRML2.0.
00020 
00021 #ifndef __vtkMrmlOptionsNode_h
00022 #define __vtkMrmlOptionsNode_h
00023 
00024 //#include <iostream.h>
00025 //#include <fstream.h>
00026 #include "vtkMrmlNode.h"
00027 #include "vtkSlicer.h"
00028 
00029 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlOptionsNode : public vtkMrmlNode
00030 {
00031   public:
00032   static vtkMrmlOptionsNode *New();
00033   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlOptionsNode,vtkMrmlNode);
00034   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00035   
00036   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00037   // Utility Functions
00038   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 
00040   // Description:
00041   // Write the node's attributes
00042   void Write(ofstream& of, int indent);
00043 
00044   // Description:
00045   // Copy the nodes attributes to this object
00046   void Copy(vtkMrmlNode *node);
00047 
00048   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049   // Get and Set Functions
00050   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 
00052   // Description:
00053   // Name of the program that should recognize these options.
00054   vtkGetStringMacro(Program);
00055   vtkSetStringMacro(Program);
00056 
00057   // Description:
00058   // Short description of the contents of this node. ie: 'presets'
00059   vtkGetStringMacro(Contents);
00060   vtkSetStringMacro(Contents);
00061 
00062   // Description:
00063   // List of options expressed in this form: key1='value1' key2='value2'
00064   vtkGetStringMacro(Options);
00065   vtkSetStringMacro(Options);
00066 
00067   protected:
00068   vtkMrmlOptionsNode();
00069   ~vtkMrmlOptionsNode();
00070   vtkMrmlOptionsNode(const vtkMrmlOptionsNode&) {};
00071   void operator=(const vtkMrmlOptionsNode&) {};
00072 
00073   // Description:
00074   // Contains information for use by specified program
00075   // Not needed here since superclass vtkMrmlNode has Options
00076   //char *Options;
00077 
00078   // Description:
00079   // Name of program that uses these options (i.e. Slicer)
00080   char *Program;
00081   // Description:
00082   // Type of Options stored in this node (i.e. user preferences)
00083   char *Contents;
00084 };
00085 
00086 #endif
